name: places/ChIJ_Z9mIBv2wokRSPjDfyU5nnI
formattedAddress: 1475 Park Ave, New York, NY 10029, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1475 Park Ave, New York, NY 10029, USA

originalText.text:
Where do I begin? I am a previous employee of Northside Center. The students were the highlight of my job. The staff would talk negatively about other staff and the children and families with senior management, The company only cares about how they look to investors. They know how to put on this big con show for funders. The founders from 70 years ago would not be so impressed with how you treat your employees. Stop walking all over them and treating them like they are beneath you. Learn what being on a team is all about.

Management use workers and fire them if they see that they are very outspoken and does not agree to some of their unhealthy decisions. I consistently went to the administration for support and I was immediately dismiss. These people seem to get enormous pleasure from writing people up, and micro management from the executive office to the direct supervisor and finding creative ways to make everyone’s work life a complete misery.

Undertrained teachers, lazy unmotivated terrible Director of Special Education Services Carolina Laise- Chong. Carolina doesn’t even know how to do her job push her work on everyone else. Carolina has four Assistants unreal.

The HR department is a joke it's only one staff and they finally got an HR Director. Let’s see how long that lasts since the last HR Director quit. A lot of turnover in teams, no consistent teams
.
Northside Center don’t even care about the children all they are worried about is the money.

Their management is OLD and antiquated and definitely needs to be revamped with new brighter younger staff which goes into the next fact that management SUCKS!

THE AFTER SCHOOL AND SCHOOL PROGRAM NORTHSIDE HAVE IS HORRIBLE THEY DO NOT DO ANYTHING WITH THE CHILDREN.

Cons
- Toxic environment
- Little room to grow within
- Need to pay staff more
- A volatile work environment that will not change until a regime change.
- It will the sense of no common sense of power that "some people" want to impose and as result others gets discourage.

Advice to Management:

* Upper management can be better. Less micromanaging.
* Always be open to listen to new ideas not matter how great or small they can be, Be willing to supervise in a time manner to avoid further discussion or concern, Make people feel understandable, and loved.
* Get some new fresher, younger, leadership that is not going to waste money on paper and temps. Pay people what they deserve and set a more realistic standard which will yield better results.
* Stop hiring and firing and focus on the welfare of the students you serve and staff. Most workers are very unhappy and stressed when coming to work. Make the working environment an enjoyable place for children to learn....... If the staff are stressed it affects the children please.....
* Retire

I would highly recommend you not to apply for this agency! RUN RUN RUN!

originalText.text: Dr crespo's attitude is crazy. She needs to shut up and listen before she speaks instead of talking over patients. She should be fired and her license should be revoked. Shes a terrible doctor.

text.text: Dr crespo's attitude is crazy. She needs to shut up and listen before she speaks instead of talking over patients. She should be fired and her license should be revoked. Shes a terrible doctor.

originalText.text: I am a previous employee of Northside Center. I worked there for only 6 months because I couldn't stand to work there the entire year. The students were the highlight of my job and I wish I could've worked with them longer. The staff would talk negatively about a child in front of them and do not prioritize what is best for the child. The company only cares about how they look to investors. I was told that my student who couldn't walk should not crawl on the floor to gym because "it didn't look good". The librarian didn't know how to work with my students because they were "too low". Any time I advocated for my students and their rights, I was immediately shot down. I consistently went to the administration for support regarding staff in my classroom being unprofessional, lazy, and physical with the students, but nothing was ever said or done. The one good thing that the company did was allow me to work and get paid as a licensed teacher while we were waiting for my NY teaching license to reciprocate. I met with HR after submitting my 2 weeks notice and informed them of everything I experienced and witnessed. I would never work here again and I would not recommend this center to any parent looking for a therapeutic center for their child.

originalText.text: The after-school and summer program staff are unprofessional and act like children themselves.  I would not recommend anyone to send their child to this place. They yell at your kids, and act like they really don't care too much for the kids. They have some guy name Justice who is unprofessional running the program. He is not good. Communication is horrible. Think twice about leaving your child in this program.

originalText.text: Do not work here the people are unprofessional specially Rebecca Mejia she offered me the summer job and I accepted the job but then she gave me no information said maybe I would start Monday the 17 but gave me no confirmation and a squedule even though I sent emails and called to get information and when I went to find out what was happenning she blamed the miscommunication on me and took the job offer away I feel like I was played with and discrimated by this organization specially I feel I was disrespected by Rebecca Mejia.
